channel.title: Running Server help
channel.description:
OK, So I recently started a server, but its not entirely working.
I've downloaded a source. I've registered at No-Ip and have the No-Ip DUC downloaded and my server ip is checked. And I have portforwarded too.
But, when I run my runserver.bat it says my servers online. For some reason it says the name of the source is online. I've checked all the files but I dont have a clue where its getting the name from. Idk if that matters, but then when I try to log into my server it doesn't work. It only works if I log into it on 0.0.0.0 . Which I know isnt right. My No-IP DUC says my server ip is running, too. I have no idea whats wrong. Any help please?

item.title: Running Server help
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

It has to be somewhere… Use a zfilesearcher.

Read full topic

item.title: Running Server help
item.dc:creator: @iPENGUIN iPENGUIN
item.description:
@iPENGUIN wrote:

nope I’ve searched “all” “allstar” and “allstar-scape”. I’ve tried so many things and it’s not there. It’s not in client.java or in the runserver.bat

EDIT: I downloaded the source again and checked in server.java and found the place where it says - Allstar-Scape v1 - … Online and changed it to my server. I remembered doing this for my other source, too. Anyway, when I ran this new source. It said the same thing… allstar scape is online… -.-

Read full topic

item.title: Running Server help
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Should be in server.

Read full topic

item.title: Running Server help
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Can you post what it says when you run it?

Read full topic

item.title: Running Server help
item.dc:creator: @iPENGUIN iPENGUIN
item.description:
@iPENGUIN wrote:

Its not in server.java… how do I check the batch file? Right-click and edit? Cause I looked at that and it’s not in there either…

Read full topic

item.title: Running Server help
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Port 80 is used for websites, 43594 is used for Runescape servers. You need to portforward 43594, Your runserver.bat might be getting it from Server.java or the batch file itself.

Read full topic

item.title: Running Server help
item.dc:creator: @iPENGUIN iPENGUIN
item.description:
@iPENGUIN wrote:

Ok.

I’ve checked EVERY SINGLE one of my files and no where inside of them is the name of my source. So I don’t know where the runserver.bat is getting the name from…

Do I only need to portforward 43594? I remember someone saying I needed to forward port 80 too for No-IP or something…

Read full topic

item.title: Running Server help
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

You need to be portforwarded.

Read full topic

item.title: Running Server help
item.dc:creator: @iPENGUIN iPENGUIN
item.description:
@iPENGUIN wrote:

Also, my friend just tried logging into my server with my server ip and it didnt work for him…

Read full topic

item.title: Running Server help
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

It doesn’t harm or help your server.

Read full topic

item.title: Running Server help
item.dc:creator: @iPENGUIN iPENGUIN
item.description:
@iPENGUIN wrote:

Yeah I looked up a guide for my specific router for rsps’s and its all correct. Thanks. I checked my client.java but its not there… I clicked edit on runserver… and it had mysql in it… I dont need to know anything about mysql do I?

Read full topic

item.title: Running Server help
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

[quote=“lord killord, post:5, topic:332961”][quote author=deathschaos9 link=topic=429383.msg3152453#msg3152453 date=1268684130]
The host of the server logs in using 0.0.0.0 or localhost. Everyone else uses the no-ip.
[/quote]

No … the owner should still be able to enter the server using the no-ip address …[/quote]

No… It wont accept the connection from the host computer if your using the no-ip or the Ip directly. There are very few occasions where a No-Ip can be used to log into a host computer, and even when that’s possible the lag is terrible.

@iPENGUIN

If your using another computer on the same network, use the host computers default gateway.

Read full topic

item.title: Running Server help
item.dc:creator: @lord_killord lord killord
item.description:
@lord_killord wrote:

yeah you’ve got to go into the client.java clientside (well I’m pretty sure its client.java) and then search “setserver”
wherever you see an ip adress, change it to yours. (should be only twice)

If not, check to make sure that the no-ip is changing your actual ip adress to the ip adress you chose and not the ip adress from some other computer. And make sure that the portforwarding is 100%.

deathschaos9:

The host of the server logs in using 0.0.0.0 or localhost. Everyone else uses the no-ip.

No … the owner should still be able to enter the server using the no-ip adress …

Read full topic

item.title: Running Server help
item.dc:creator: @iPENGUIN iPENGUIN
item.description:
@iPENGUIN wrote:

Thanks for the quick responses…

I tried to get on with another computer of mine. Would that not work at all? Because 0.0.0.0 and my server ip won’t work for it.

Correct me if I’m wrong, 0.0.0.0 is for the computer your hosting off of and the server ip is for outside of your router?

Read full topic

item.title: Running Server help
item.dc:creator: @Wafflenat3r Wafflenat3r
item.description:
@Wafflenat3r wrote:

The host of the server always uses either

0.0.0.0 127.0.0.1 localhost (blank)

as an IP to connect to themselves. Everybody else uses the no-ip. When the command prompt says

(source) is online!

it’s not the problem, and this can be changed usually in server.java or the .bat source itself.

Read full topic

item.title: Running Server help
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

The host of the server logs in using 0.0.0.0 or localhost. Everyone else uses the no-ip.

Read full topic
